title: What Does It Mean When Pluto Is in Scorpio?

steps.title: This combination is special because Pluto is Scorpio’s ruling planet.
steps.content: This combination is special because Pluto is Scorpio’s ruling planet. It’s important to know that each astrological sign is ruled by a certain planet, and this planet greatly affects the astrological sign’s traits. Pluto is Scorpio’s ruling planet, so the two are extremely similar in many ways, such as being rather dark and mysterious. So it’s extra special when Pluto ends up in Scorpio during its revolution around space, and this alignment often causes the characteristics of the two elements to become much more exaggerated. [1] X Research source Therefore, if you have Pluto in Scorpio on your birth chart, your Scorpio traits, such as your loyalty, passion, and love of privacy, are likely even stronger than the average Scorpio’s.

steps.title: They have powerful intuition.
steps.content: They have powerful intuition. Scorpios in general are known to be very intuitive, almost to the point where it feels like they have a sixth sense for discovering the truth of things. With Pluto’s influence, this intuition becomes even stronger, and it might feel like they almost have psychic abilities. After all, Pluto is a planet that represents things hidden below the surface. [2] X Trustworthy Source Association for Psychological Science Nonprofit organization devoted promoting trustworthy research and education in the psychological sciences Go to source This drive to discover hidden truths and facts can also lead them to become somewhat obsessive. Beware of this trait, since Pluto’s influence tends to amplify these obsessive tendencies. If you have Pluto in Scorpio, take some time to meditate and distance yourself when you feel obsession beginning to take over. This intuition can also cause people with Pluto in Scorpio to be very skeptical of people and things around them. To them, it might feel like everyone has a hidden agenda. Such skepticism can cause some people with Pluto in Scorpio to be more cynical than the average person.

steps.title: They are intense and passionate individuals.
steps.content: They are intense and passionate individuals. As someone with Pluto in Scorpio, they often crave passion and put everything they have behind their efforts, whether its their career, friendships, or romantic relationships. Their passion often drives them to seek a deeper understanding of who they are what their place in this universe is. Such passion can also affects their romantic life, and they tend to be very sexual, deep, and intense with their partner. When Pluto is in Scorpio, this passion is amplified, but it also has the potential to lead to danger and accidents. If you have Pluto in Scorpio, be aware that such intense passion can blind you to certain dangers. Always be sure to take a break from your pursuits for a little while and reassess your actions and motivations.

steps.title: They seek exciting new experiences and are very creative.
steps.content: They seek exciting new experiences and are very creative. Due to Scorpio’s influence, these individuals are likely always looking for a new adventure and excitement. Since Pluto is all about transformation and new beginnings, their desire to experience everything the world has to offer and start a new chapter is probably even stronger. Experiencing so many new things also makes them very creative individuals who can express themselves in a variety of ways. Because Pluto is the planet of growth and renewal, as well as destruction and creation, they might seek new experiences in the hopes that they’ll experience personal growth along the way. If you’re part of the generation with Pluto in Scorpio, be sure to take time to self-reflect and think about how such new experiences will change you for the better.

steps.title: They are powerful and driven.
steps.content: They are powerful and driven. Unfortunately, Pluto is known for bringing about sudden and dramatic changes. Things like illness, betrayal, setbacks, and even death are things these individuals might have experienced with Pluto in Scorpio. However, they’re also very resilient and powerful individuals who aren’t likely to back down even when things get tough. Thankfully, such drive and passion often leads to growth. Unfortunately, this resilience can easily turn into stubbornness, which is a common trait of fixed signs like Scorpio. Always be sure to keep an open mind if you have Pluto in Scorpio. You never know what you can learn from others and the diverse opinions they have to share.

steps.title: They can be very controlling.
steps.content: They can be very controlling. Many Scorpios naturally like to take control and lead others. As someone who’s personality is influenced by Scorpio, a person with Pluto in Scorpio might not shy away from being in a position of power and may even crave having such influence over others. However, the darker influences of Pluto can cause this need for control to turn into manipulation of others. Because of Pluto, feelings of disdain and rage when things don’t go as planned can also pop up. At times, a person may even think about taking revenge on those who’ve hurt them. Such need for control can also make them very jealous and spiteful if they feel like they’re being threatened. If you also have Pluto in Scorpio, take some time to be by yourself to gain control of your emotions when they begin to boil over. Sitting with your emotions and processing them can help you avoid making rash decisions.

steps.title: They may come off as dark and mysterious.
steps.content: They may come off as dark and mysterious. As a water sign, Scorpios are naturally very in tune with their emotions. They’re usually not afraid to explore and confront emotions, but they often prefer to do this in their head. [3] X Research source Scorpios also tend to prefer keeping their personal details personal, and this might cause them to come off as mysterious to those around them. As the farthest (former) planet from the sun, Pluto has also been given a reputation of being very dark and mysterious, which is probably why it has such an affinity for Scorpio. If you have Pluto in Scorpio, your mysterious and secretive tendencies likely become even stronger. Just remember to make an effort to open up to the people closest to you to show that you trust and value them. This group of individual’s ability to be in touch with their emotions also makes them very empathetic and understanding to those close to them. Reader Poll: We asked 261 wikiHow readers if they think Scorpios are generally more mysterious or open, and 91% agreed that Scorpios are mysterious and it may take a while to get to know them . [Take Poll]

steps.title: The Pluto in Scorpio generation persevered through extreme changes.
steps.content: The Pluto in Scorpio generation persevered through extreme changes. The Pluto in Scorpio generation includes those who were born between 1983 and 1995, when Pluto was transiting into Scorpio from Libra. Due to Pluto’s position within Scorpio during this time, these individuals likely went through extreme and, more often than not, difficult changes. Pluto is all about destruction for the sake of renewal, so they likely experienced hardships like debt, illness, or even death. However, their strong will and determination were also amplified, and their generation has some of the toughest individuals out there. Pluto’s transit into Scorpio gave birth to many critical issues that dealt with things like sex and power, two very important characteristics of Scorpio. Pluto’s transits are often marked by extreme changes that can be either positive or negative depending on where the transit is occurring.

steps.title: They tend to like to be in control.
steps.content: They tend to like to be in control. While most Scorpios tend to prefer to be in control, women influenced by both Pluto and Scorpio are a true force to be reckoned with. You’ll likely find them in high positions of power, and they’re extremely strong and influential people. Their resourcefulness and strong intuition help them greatly, and they can be truly inspiring and creative leaders. However, at their worst, they can turn manipulative. [4] X Research source Due to Scorpio’s influence, they can also come off as arrogant to some in their pursuit of power.

steps.title: They can be secretive at times.
steps.content: They can be secretive at times. In true Scorpio fashion, women with Pluto in Scorpio tend to value their privacy. Because of their excellent intuition and desire to learn as much as possible, Scorpio women have earned a lot of wisdom, but they tend to prefer keeping this wisdom to themselves. The mysteriousness of Pluto makes them all the more private, and it can take a while to get them to open up to you. [5] X Trustworthy Source Greater Good Magazine Journal published by UC Berkeley's Greater Good Science Center, which uses scientific research to promote happier living Go to source If you’re interested in starting a relationship with a woman who has Pluto in Scorpio, be a bit mysterious with her and don’t reveal everything about yourself right away. Scorpio women in general love the thrill of the chase, and Pluto’s influence tends to heighten this desire for mystery.

steps.title: They are loyal to those they care about.
steps.content: They are loyal to those they care about. Women with Pluto in Scorpio are extremely dedicated not only to their passions but also to the people they truly care about. They’re loyal friends, passionate partners, and dedicated wives. However, keep in mind that Pluto’s influence can easily bring about feelings of jealousy and obsession if they feel like their relationships are being threatened. [6] X Research source If you have a woman in your life who has Pluto in Scorpio, do whatever you can to remain loyal to her. Offer her support when she needs it, spend quality time with her , and communicate your honest feelings whenever you can.

steps.title: They’re often calm on the outside but fierce on the inside.
steps.content: They’re often calm on the outside but fierce on the inside. Men with Pluto in Scorpio are known for having very calm dispositions, and they tend to be very patient with others. Such traits give them quite magnetic personalities, and you might find yourself naturally drawn to them. But that doesn’t mean that they can’t be aggressive, especially when they feel threatened. They can turn quite possessive and even dangerous when backed into a corner, a trait amplified by Pluto’s powers. [7] X Trustworthy Source Cleveland Clinic Educational website from one of the world's leading hospitals Go to source If you wish to be with a man who has Pluto in Scorpio, it’s best to always be honest with him and practice good communication skills to keep him calm.

steps.title: They can be very fearless and confident.
steps.content: They can be very fearless and confident. Scorpios in general tend to be very sure of themselves and their abilities which is why they make such great leaders. Men with Pluto in Scorpio are downright fearless and have an unmatched courage and confidence within them. They’re determined to achieve their goals and won’t let anything stand in their way. [8] X Research source The best thing to do for a man with Pluto in Scorpio is stick by his side and support his passions with the same kind of confidence he has. Ask him about the work he’s doing, listen when he comes to you with a problem, and always be there to cheer him on when things get difficult.

steps.title: They often want a deep emotional connection.
steps.content: They often want a deep emotional connection. Men with Pluto in Scorpio are very in touch with their emotions and empathetic toward other people. In most cases, they have a desire to form deeper emotional connections with people they consider close. They can also be very compassionate and understanding, making them that much more attractive to others. [9] X Trustworthy Source Science Direct Online archive of peer-reviewed research on scientific, technical and medical topics Go to source To help form this emotional bond with a man who has Pluto in Scorpio, don’t be afraid to have deep conversations and allow yourself to be vulnerable. Emotional connections are all about cultivating trust and openness with the other person.
